bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 12 (Monday, January 26, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TOM PRICE of Georgia:H.J. Res. 26.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article V whereby the U.S. Constitution may be altered.____________________[Page H583]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution and Civil Justice.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Constitutional Amendment

Limits Members of the House of Representatives to nine terms and Members of the Senate to three terms.

bill.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the number of years Representatives and Senators may serve.

item.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the number of years Representatives and Senators may serve.
Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the number of years Representatives and Senators may serve.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
